gurmukhi: ਭੲੀ ਅਸਟ ਸੈ ਕੋਸ ਲੳੁ ਛੱਤ੍ਰ ਛਾਯੰ ||
transliteration: Bhaiast Sai Kos Lau Chhattra Chhaadan||
translation: The shade of canopies spread over eight hundred kos.
And the sun and moon sped away and Indra, the king of gods was frightened.2.124.

gurmukhi: ਭਕਾ ਭੁੰਕ ਭੇਰੀ ਢਕਾ ਢੁੰਕ ਢੋਲੰ ||
transliteration: Bhakaa Bhounk Bheroo Dhakaa Dhounk Dholan||
translation: The drum and the tabor reverberated.

gurmukhi: ਫਟੀ ਨਖ ਸਿੰਘੰ ਮੁਖੰ ਡੱਢ ਕੋਲੰ ||
translation: The earth splitted because of the roar of the lion and the attack of his nails.
The sound of the trumpets and the tabors is being heard.
And the huge vultures and crows are shrieking and flying .3.125.

gurmukhi: ਖੁਰੰ ਖੇਹ ੳੁੱਠੀ ਰਹਿਓ ਗੈਨ ਪੂਰੰ ||
transliteration: Khuran Kheh Outthi Rahio Gadn Pooran||
translation: The sky is filled with the dust risen by the hooves of the animals.

gurmukhi: ਦਲੇ ਸਿੰਧ ਬਿੱਧੰ ਭੲੇ ਪੱਬ ਚੂਰੰ ||
transliteration: Dale Sindh Biddhan Bhae Pabb Chooran||
translation: And these animals have broken into prices Vidhyachal mountain and other small mounts.

gurmukhi: ਸੁਣੋ ਸੋਰ ਕਾਲੀ ਗਹੇ ਸਸਤ੍ਰ ਪਾਣੰ ||
transliteration: Souno Sor Kaaloo Gade Sastra Paanan||
translation: The goddess Kali hearing the din, held her weapons in her hands.
While roaring she ate up the limps of the killed youthful warriors.4.126.

gurmukhi: ਗਜੇ ਬੀਰ ਗਾਜੀ || ਤੁਰੇ ਤੁੰਦ ਤਾਜੀ ||
transliteration: Gade Boor Gadj89|| Ture Tound Taajoo||
translation: The brave warriors are thundering and the horses are speedily moving.
The bows are being pulled and the shafts are raining.5.127.

gurmukhi: ੲਿਤੈ ਸਿੰਘੁ ਗੱਜਯੋ || ਮਹਾ ਸੰਖ ਬੱਜਯੋ ||
transliteration: Itai Singh(u0 Gadjyo|| Mahaa Sankh Bajjyo||
translation: From this side the lion hath roared and the conch hath been blown.
